pageContext.description: Small socketed celt in good condition. Edge quite sharp, one end of it broken off (the fracture is ancient). Prominent mould marks. A single rib runs down the centre of each face; well-formed symetrical socket.
pageContext.patina: very dark brown patina, of the usual kind for peat
pageContext.site: Wales, Glamorgan, Pontypridd, Found Jan. 1852 while sinking a drain in peat, Pw, NÂ° 490
pageContext.toSearch: Pontypridd, Rhondda Cynon Taf, United Kingdom
pageContext.remarks: Found in a drawer, with label tied on giving find-place, in R.A.S.'s now on his retirement, January 1938.
